title: Advanced Code Search Tools
description:
Implement intelligent code search capabilities for Consoul inspired by Aider's RepoMap and other AI coding assistants.

## Vision
Transform Consoul from basic bash execution to a true coding assistant with semantic code understanding, enabling users to:
- Search code by structure and semantics, not just text
- Navigate codebases intelligently
- Find symbol definitions and references
- Understand code relationships

## Approach
Three-tier implementation:
1. Fast text search (ripgrep-based) - Quick wins
2. AST-based code search (Aider's RepoMap approach) - Core functionality  
3. Optional LSP integration (Serena-style) - Advanced features

## Success Criteria
- Code search tools integrated into SDK
- Performance comparable to Aider
- Works with 20+ major languages
- Zero-config for basic usage
- Documented and tested

## Dependencies
- grep-ast library
- tree-sitter parsers
- ripgrep (optional, with fallback)

## Reference
Based on research from SOUL-91 comparing:
- Aider (RepoMap with tree-sitter)
- Serena (LSP-based)
- cursor-agent (hybrid approach)
- OpenCode (LSP integration)
- wcgw (file-based)

## Timeline
Estimate: 3-4 weeks for full implementation
- Week 1: Text search + infrastructure
- Week 2: AST parsing + RepoMap
- Week 3: Symbol search + references  
- Week 4: Testing + documentation
